awards.description: 1st place will get $1024. 2nd place will get $512. 3rd place will get $256. Judges will determine the top three apps.
awards.title: Best Overall App

awards.description: Intel's judges will choose the one that interests them the most
awards.title: Intel's Choice

awards.description: You can win a free Raspberry Pi or an OpenWRT device if you make your own stack (Ex. raspberrylinuxnginxpostgrepythonpyramid)
awards.title: Best Combo or Open Source Tech

awards.description: You can win a free Raspberry Pi or an OpenWRT device if you can build something cool using a Raspberry Pi or OpenWRT device
awards.title: Best RaspberryPi/OpenWRT Hack

awards.description: Use Salesforce as a back end to fuel live data. Access data using any of the various Salesforce APIs. Bonus points will go to the app with a real world application and original business use case.
awards.title: Best use of Salesforce as a back end

awards.description: Solve a real world problem with your project. IBM Goodies include: A sling backpack, mp3 speaker, 8gb thumb drive, rectangle phone charger, and an IBM key chain
awards.title: Best solution to real-world problem

awards.description: This award goes out to the team that creates the best app that shows the value of low latency/high capacity fiber. What will you do with a gig Internet?
awards.title: App that shows value of low latency

awards.description: 1st place gets $250. 2nd place gets $100. Fitnet, fit.net, is a mobile fitness app. The app must include a scheduler and alerts. Most creative app which incorporates multiple motivators wins the prize.
awards.title: App that commits users to workout days
